projects.name: PARSE
projects.description: Police Accident Report Sampling Engine (PARSE) is a web application Production within CDAN to collect, manage, store and make available to CDAN data acquisition projects, Police Accident Reports (PAR) data collected via electronic or physical methods for the purposes of selection within a appropriate NHTSA data collection program.

projects.name: CISSWeb
projects.description: Crash Investigation Sampling System (CISS) Web (CISSWeb) application consists of motor vehicle crash and injury data collected from Police Accident Reports (PARS) gathered through a network of remote field sites around the country operated and managed under contract by NHTSA.  CISSWeb is the application that consolidates all the data collected within the lifecycle of the case, regardless of the source. Specific PARs are selected for followup investigation via a sample algorithm designed to target towed late model vehicle, specific injuries and/or crashes of special interest to NHTSA. In addition to PAR and injury data, field Data Technicians collect data by inspecting and recording damage to case vehicles, inspecting and collecting data from crash scenes and enhancing vehicle and scene data with digital imagery. When possible, contractors conduct occupant interviews.  NHTSA uses the CISS data collected to evaluate the conditions present at the time of the crash, injuries resulting from crashes, vehicle crashworthiness, special types of crashes (e.g., air bag deployment), and crashes of high public interest (e.g., school bus crashes).

projects.name: Toolbox

projects.name: Edit Checks

projects.name: iREx
projects.description: iREx (integrated Risk Executive) is a NHTSA-developed  automated Risk Management system for its IT investments. It is compliant to federal regulations (implements NIST SP 800-37 Risk Management Framework guidance and processes) to ensure that Risk-based decision making is a tangible feature of the NHTSA risk management processes. It is collaboratively used by NHTSA's PMO, EA, CPIC and cybersecurity components in risk-based decisioning. iREx ensures that risk mitigation is linked to identifiable combinations of security issues that are recorded and managed in order to address and measure each relevant risk and vulnerability.  iREx is a web-based application with a SQL-based database back-end.  It has capabilities to generate Assessment and Analysis reports used to support DOT/NHTSA Risk Posture, and C&A of its IT systems.

projects.name: NAF
projects.description: NAF (NHTSA Asset Framework) is the NHTSA-developed system that serves as its IT Asset metadata management, analysis and reporting platform. This  includes  IT hardware, software assets information in the following contexts: technical specifications, licensing information, SLA management, capital planning, acquisition, and enterprise architecture (TRM).

projects.name: MR Tool (SDAG)
projects.description: MR Tool (Service Data Architecture Group Metadata Repository) is the NHTSA-developed DOT standard system that supports  DOT's continuing implementation of OMB M-13-13 (through DOT Order 1351.34) for DOT OA data and information to be disclosed rapidly in forms that the public can readily find and use.  As such, it is tailored as an analysis and reporting system holding metadata  describing DOT OA datasets, and is designed to conform to the latest federal Open Data metadata schema (https://project-open-data.cio.gov/v1.1/schema/).

projects.name: TravelOnTrack
projects.description: TravelOnTrack is used to track allocated agency travel budgets by office and fiscal year. It manages and tracks submitted travel proposals, plans and completed travel information, including associated budget and overage data. It enables transfer of unused funds in an office as necessary. TravelOnTrack generates summary reports on available funds and usage of approved/proposed travels and other travel-related reports.

projects.name: SISAME
projects.description: NHTSA funded the development of the SISAME program starting in the late 1980ís until the mid 2000ís.  This program provides a very unique capability for mass/spring multibody model extraction from test data.   NHTSA has discontinued support or development for the SISAME program

projects.name: vPIC-List
projects.description: The NHTSA Product Information Catalog and Vehicle Listing (vPIC) is a consolidated platform that presents data collected within the manufacturer reported data from CFR 49 Parts 551 ñ 574 for use in a variety of modern tools. NHTSAís vPIC platform is intended to serve as a centralized source for basic Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) decoding, Manufacturer Information Database (MID), Manufacturer Equipment Plant Identification and associated data.  vPIC is primarily intended for use on Model Years 1995 forward. Data prior to 1995 may be available depending on the manufacturer, which is based on submittals received by NHTSA. This includes passenger vehicles, trucks, buses, trailers / trailer kits, incomplete vehicles, low speed vehicles and motorcycles to name a few as the primary categories. Vehicles within these major categories are further defined by the details provided by the manufacturers in accordance to reporting standards of CFR 49 Part 565 and 566.

projects.vcs: Available as part of download (password protected)

projects.name: Unmanned Aircraft Systems Registration Service (UASRS)
projects.description: The Unmanned Aircraft Systems Registration Service (UASRS) is used by the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) to provide small Unmanned Aircraft System (sUAS) operators/owners a service to register all sUAS for the purpose of Production sUAS in U.S. air space. sUAS are defined as those aircraft that weigh more than 0.55 pounds but less than 55 pounds. This service educates new operators about airspace rules so they can use their unmanned aircraft safely. As part of the registration process, registrants acknowledge that they have read, understand, and intend to follow the safety guidance. The service allows the FAA to identify and take enforcement action against those who intentionally violate the rules or operate unsafely.
projects.vcs: Amazon EC2 is hosted in multiple locations worldwide. These locations are composed of regions and Availability Zones. Each region is a separate geographic area. Each region has multiple, isolated locations known as Availability Zones.

projects.name: B4UFly
projects.description: B4UFLY is a UAS Mobile Application that enables a small UAS or model aircraft operator the ability to check their current location for conformance with FAA published guidelines prior to flight operations.  This will assist model aircraft users to conform to Public Law 112-95, Section 336: Special Rule for Model Aircraft (FMRA) which outlines what a model aircraft is and how it can be legally operated within the national airspace.
projects.vcs: General public can download this app from the App Store for iOS or Google Play store

projects.name: EDAI
projects.description: External Data Access Initiative (EDAi) provides the private sector greater access to core FAA data to spur more innovation in the aviation industry, and ultimately advance the FAAís mission of safety in flight.  Based on stakeholder recommendations, this initiativeís first effort strived to provide both more data and better data for Aeronautical products and information.    Solution Delivery developed and deployed web services for several aeronautical products including both information about those products and the ability to automatically download those products which satisfied one of the recommendations.

projects.name: EDCS
projects.description: Enterprise Data Control Service Focus - A set of common infrastructure services.  Web based common access point (interface) - Fully documented data history enabling trust - Access control is documented and enforced - Enabled data resources have REST APIs that comply with documentation and dissemination control
projects.vcs: Hosted in Atlantic City Data Center, Code base is in Bitbucket at the AIT Vendor facility,In process of moving code to AIT Git Repository.
